modules.description: Provides monadic operations for asynchronous I/O, including binding and lifting values into the I/O context. Works with Lwt promises to represent asynchronous computations. Enables non-blocking file reading, network communication, and event-driven I/O handling.

Handles TCP and SSL/TLS connection setup and listening, abstracting underlying SSL implementations like OpenSSL or the native OCaml TLS stack. Operates with socket descriptors, connection states, and protocol configurations. Enables secure communication in networked applications by managing handshakes and data transmission.

Provides functions to initialize and manipulate a resolver that uses Lwt for asynchronous operations, including composing service functions and applying rewrite rules to URI resolution. Works with types such as service functions, rewrite functions, and URI endpoints, enabling custom resolution logic for network addresses. Used to dynamically adjust hostname resolution, such as mapping virtual machine names to shared memory channels or overriding domain-specific lookup behavior.
